DOC.brief_summary: This study will evaluate the efficacy of cyclosporine ophthalmic solution vs. other non-prescription treatments in patients with dry eye disease. Patient and physician assessments completed at baseline, at each follow-up visit (follow-up visits are variable as per physician discretion) and at final follow-up visit.
DOC.brief_title: Efficacy Study of Cyclosporine Ophthalmic Emulsion in Patients With Dry Eye Disease
DOC.criteria: Diagnosis of dry eye disease Currently using artificial tears daily Male or female of legal age of consent Normal lid position and closure Exclusion Criteria Patients currently using cyclosporine ophthalmic emulsion 0.05% Participation in other investigational drug or device study Any current or previous topical ophthalmic or oral cyclosporine use within the last three years
